com.dreamtek.smartpos.deviceservice.aidl

Interface IPrinter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IPrinter.Default, IPrinter.Stub

    public interface IPrinter

    The printer object to print strings, barcode, QR code, image

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IPrinter.Default
      Default implementation for IPrinter.
      static class  IPrinter.Stub
      Local-side IPC implementation stub class.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        int getStatus()
       throws android.os.RemoteException

        get printer status

        Returns:
        the status:
        • ERROR_NONE(0x00) - normal
        • ERROR_PAPERENDED(0xF0) - Paper out
        • ERROR_NOCONTENT(0xF1) - no content
        • ERROR_HARDERR(0xF2) - printer error
        • ERROR_OVERHEAT(0xF3) - over heat
        • ERROR_NOBM(0xF6) - no black mark
        • ERROR_BUSY(0xF7) - printer is busy
        • ERROR_MOTORERR(0xFB) - moto error
        • ERROR_LOWVOL(0xE1) - battery low
        • ERROR_NOTTF(0xE2) - no ttf
        • ERROR_BITMAP_TOOWIDE(0xE3) - width of bitmap too wide
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • setGray

        void setGray(int gray)
      throws android.os.RemoteException

        Set the gray level of printing

        Parameters:
        gray - the value from 0 to 7
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • addText

        void addText(android.os.Bundle format,
             java.lang.String text)
      throws android.os.RemoteException

        Add text string to print

        Parameters:
        format - set text format, the key of format param as follow:
        • intfont
        • StringfontStyle; sustom font type by passing /xxxx/abc.ttf, default is using /system/fonts/fzzdx.ttf if not set
        • booleanbold; {code true}:bold, @{code false}:normal
        • intalign; {code 0}:left, @{code 1}:center, @{code 2}:right
        • booleannewline; {code true}:new line after prin, @{code false}:normal
        • floatscale_w; (descrption: multiple Width)
        • floatscale_h; (descrption: multiple Height)

        the key of font format as follow:

        • 0(description:small(size16))
        • 1(description:normal(size24))
        • 2(description:normal_bigger(size24 double height & bold))
        • 3(description:large(size32))
        • 4(description:large_bigger(size32 double height & bold))
        • 5(description:huge(size48))
        • 6(description:normal_wide(size24 double width & bold))
        • 7(description:large_wide(size32 double width & bold))) 

        
      Bundle bundle = new Bundle;
      bundle.putBoolean("bold", true);
      bundle.putBoolean("newline", true);
      bundle.putInt("font", 1);
      bundle.putInt("align", 1);
      bundle.putFloat("scale_w", 1.5f);
      bundle.putFloat("scale_h", 1.5f);
        text - the text string want to print
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • addTextInLine

        void addTextInLine(android.os.Bundle format,
                   java.lang.String lString,
                   java.lang.String mString,
                   java.lang.String rString,
                   int mode)
            throws android.os.RemoteException

        Add text strings to print.

        Parameters:
        format - set text format, the key of format param as follow:
        • intfontSize
        • booleanbold; {code true}:bold, @{code false}:normal
        • StringfontStyle

        the key of fontSize format as follow:

        • 0(description:small(size16))
        • 1(description:normal(size24))
        • 2(description:normal_bigger(size24 double height & bold))
        • 3(description:large(size32))

        the key of fontStyle format as follow:

        • /xxxx/xx.ttf(absolute path, custom font by user)

        
      Bundle bundle = new Bundle;
      bundle.putBoolean("bold", true);
      bundle.putInt("fontSize", 1);
        lString - the left justifying String
        mString - the middle(center) justifying String
        rString - the right justifying String
        mode - - 0 : If there is a middle column, the width of the left, middle, and right columns is flexibly assigned based on the middle column. If there is no middle column, the width of the left & right columns is flexibly assigned. {code 1} : the width of the left & right columns is flexibly assigned. {code 2} : the logic same as code 0, but use new SDK print method, recommended
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • addBarCode

        void addBarCode(android.os.Bundle format,
                java.lang.String barcode)
         throws android.os.RemoteException

        Add barcode to print(CodeType Code128)

        Parameters:
        format - set bar format, the key of format param as follow:
        • align(description: 0:left, 1:center, 2:right)
        • height(description: the height of barcode)
        • barCodeType, refer to below:
          •          public enum BarcodeFormat {
             AZTEC,(only support center alignment)
             CODABAR,
             CODE_39,
             CODE_93,
             CODE_128,
             DATA_MATRIX,
             EAN_8,
             EAN_13,
             ITF,
             MAXICODE(not support),
             PDF_417,
             QR_CODE(not support),
             RSS_14(not support),
             RSS_EXPANDED,
             UPC_A,
             UPC_E,
             UPC_EAN_EXTENSION(not support);
        }
        Default: "BarcodeFormat.CODE_128.ordinal()"
        barcode - - the barcode string
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • addQrCode

        void addQrCode(android.os.Bundle format,
               java.lang.String qrCode)
        throws android.os.RemoteException

        add a QR code to print

        Parameters:
        format - set qr code format, the key of format param as follow:
        • intoffset (description:the offset from the left, if size = 384 then QR code will be center alignment)
        • intexpectedHeight (description:the expected height & width of the QR code. The actual size should multiple of the minimun pixel size of QR code)
        qrCode - the string of the QR code
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

               throws android.os.RemoteException

        Parameters:
        qrCodes - QrCodeContent
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • feedLine

        void feedLine(int lines)
       throws android.os.RemoteException

        Feed the paper

        Parameters:
        lines - lines should > 1 && lines <= 50
        The lines should be the actual lines+1 because the current line need be counted.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • addScreenCapture

        void addScreenCapture(android.os.Bundle format)
               throws android.os.RemoteException

        Add screen capture to print

        Parameters:
        format - set screen capture format, the key of format param as follow:
        • intoffset (descriptionthe offset from left)
        • intwidth (descriptionthe width want to print.(MAX = 384))
        • intheight (descriptionthe height want to print)
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
